availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Viley Ward (Scott County, Kentucky, and Washington County, Mississippi, farmer and planter)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, and Washington County, Mississippi, farmer and planter. Scott County native. Son of Junius R. Ward and Matilda Viley Ward. Married to Maria Williams on September 27, 1857. Attended the Western Military Institute in Georgetown, Kentucky. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Planter in Washington County.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 1, p. 109. Biographical and Historical Memoirs of Mississippi. Vol. II (Chicago: The Goodspeed Publishing Company, 1891), 984. Find A Grave, "George Viley Ward (1832-1921)," Memorial #103618369, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/103618369/george-viley-ward (accessed January 8, 2018).
